books.title: The School for Scandal
books.author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan
books.summary: Despite their best efforts, the rumormongers of 18th-century London are disappointed by their targets.

books.title: Cleopatra
books.author: H. Rider Haggard
books.summary: An Egyptian patriot relates the tale of the fall of Cleopatra.

books.title: The Story of My Life
books.author: Helen Keller
books.summary: Helen Keller writes about her experiences as a deafblind child learning to communicate.

books.title: Tombstone
books.author: Walter Noble Burns
books.summary: An embellished retelling of the town of Tombstone, Arizona, during its heyday in the late 19th century, featuring famous heroes and outlaws of the American Old West.

books.title: The Magic City
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: A young boy, upset by his older sister’s recent marriage, builds an imaginary city out of blocks and household items and then finds himself living inside it.

books.title: Jurgen
books.author: James Branch Cabell
books.summary: Jurgen, a pawnbroker and “monstrous clever fellow,” is sent on a witty and parodic magical journey in search of true love.

books.title: The Seagull
books.author: Anton Chekhov
books.summary: A has-been actress, her ambitious playwright son, a male writer, and an aspiring young actress struggle to realize their romantic and artistic aims.

books.title: Lilith
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: After inheriting his ancestral home, a young man discovers another world inside his library and embarks on an allegorical journey.

books.title: The Rasp
books.author: Philip MacDonald
books.summary: A retired colonel investigates the elaborate murder of a cabinet minister.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Henry Kuttner
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Henry Kuttner, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: South!
books.author: Ernest Shackleton
books.summary: A British expedition sets off to cross Antarctica, but when their ship is wrecked they have to face a long struggle for survival.

books.title: Murder in the Gunroom
books.author: H. Beam Piper
books.summary: A private detective is called upon to evaluate a gun collection that contains a dark secret.

books.title: The Economic Consequences of the Peace
books.author: John Maynard Keynes
books.summary: Keynes presents a first-hand account of the 1919 Paris Peace Conference and an analysis of the resulting Versailles treaty.

books.title: Mutual Aid
books.author: Peter Kropotkin
books.summary: Kropotkin explores the role of cooperation in animal societies and human societies, past and present, and how it could benefit modern society.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Fernando Pessoa
books.summary: A collection of Fernando Pessoa’s poetry.

books.title: The Luck of Barry Lyndon
books.author: William Makepeace Thackeray
books.summary: A poor Irish rogue tries to win fame and fortune in the 18th-century English aristocracy.

books.title: Search the Sky
books.author: Frederik Pohl
books.summary: A man visits several worlds as he attempts to discover why humanity is dying out.

books.title: Old Indian Legends
books.author: Zitkála-Šá
books.summary: A collection of Dakota legends retold by Zitkála-Šá.

books.title: Paradise Lost
books.author: John Milton
books.summary: A dramatic imagining in blank verse of the rebellion of Satan against God, Satan’s overthrow, and the Fall of Man.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.
